item.title: 【Music Videos】Ariana Grande - Yes, And? [4K MasterRip | HEVC 10-bit | PCM 24-bit 48 kHz | DD+ Dolby Atmos]
item.description:
Genre: Electronic, Pop
Style: House, Dance-pop
Year: 2024
Video Source: Master, ProRes, 2160p thanks meloman67
Audio Source: Qobuz and Amazon Music, thanks moi, taytayswift133 & Yennefer

"Yes, And?" is a song by the American singer Ariana Grande and the lead single from her upcoming seventh studio album, Eternal Sunshine (2024). It was released on January 12, 2024, by Republic Records. Written and produced by Grande, Max Martin and Ilya Salmanzadeh, the song is a house and pop track with ballroom elements. The lyrics focus on overcoming negativity, addressing a range of negative press Grande has received in 2022–2023.

Music critics complimented the danceability and groove of "Yes, And?". They noted inspiration from Madonna's 1990 single "Vogue" (1990), while the accompanying music video drew inspiration from that of Paula Abdul's "Cold Hearted" (1989). Commercially, the single peaked at number one in Lithuania and within the top-five in six other countries.

Directed by Christian Breslauer and filmed in the Grand Hall of Powerhouse Arts in Brooklyn, New York City, the music video for "Yes, And?" was released via Grande's Vevo channel on YouTube at 10:00 AM EST (Eastern Standard Time) on January 12, ten hours after the song's release. The visuals were inspired by Paula Abdul's "Cold Hearted" (1989) and its "late-'80s energy". One scene in the video for "Yes, And?" features several statues of Grande, which Callie Ahlgrim and Lauren Edmonds of Business Insider observed referenced the cover artwork of her previous albums, including Yours Truly (2013), My Everything (2014), and Thank U, Next.

Release Info
The video track is encoded directly from the Master (ProRes, 2160p) with HandBrake (CQ20).
I've removed the intro and outro to match the album version and encoded it to HEVC 10-bit.
The PCM tracks are lossless (Qobuz Hi-Res 24-bit 48 kHz), synced with Adobe Audition.
The Atmos tracks are lossy (Dolby Digital Plus), synced to the video track by muxing.
The timed lyrics are synced & edited. Enable the subtitles to see the lyrics.

Note: This release contains 7 audio tracks:
Track #1: Explicit Version - PCM 24-bit 48 kHz
Track #2: Clean Version - PCM 24-bit 48 kHz
Track #3: Instrumental Version - PCM 16-bit 44.1 kHz
Track #4: Original (from the Master) - PCM 16-bit 48 kHz
Track #5: Explicit Version - Dolby Digital Plus with Dolby Atmos
Track #6: Clean Version - Dolby Digital Plus with Dolby Atmos
Track #7: Instrumental Version - Dolby Digital Plus with Dolby Atmos
